data.message: Why can I see everything my friends "like" now? This is ridiculous. I don't want to see all my friends' friends' status updates that my friends happen to "like." Please fix this. I don't have time to wade through all this stuff that is completely irrelevant to me.

replies.message: Hey Jenni. You can adjust what you see in your News Feed by following or unfollowing friends, adding people to your friends lists, and hiding stories you don't want to see. To do so, select the down arrow in the upper right corner of the story you no longer wish to see, and click "Unfollow." Hope that helps! -Sarah

No, that doesn't help at all. I don't want to unfollow my friends or hide individual stories. What I want is to receive my friends' posts without seeing all the posts by other people that my friends "like."

yeah when my friends comment on one of their friends post but it is  a friend that i do not have in common i see that on my home page why do i see peoples posts that are not my friends that means other people not my friends can see my stuff the same way
